intro: Eriogonum wootonii, commonly known as the Wooton's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum wootonii is an important plant for pollinators and is sometimes used in native plant landscaping.
